review: My Xbox 360 recently died so I was looking for a quick and easy way to watch Netflix, HBO and YouTube without having to hook my computer up and mirror the screen. Lo and behold the Google Chromecast!  Based on the specs I was pretty excited since they supported apps fall squarely in my usage pattern.  In particular, I stream a lot of live content from YouTube--mainly cricket broadcasts, so was hoping this would allow me to watch, and surf the web at the same time.  Sadly, while the support of static YouTube, Netflix, and mirroring is pretty responsive, it is a dud with live streaming--I simply could not get it to work, and YouTube also error'ed out.  It's great if you want to do do a House of Cards marathon, but not useful if you are trying to stream the Oscars or Golden Globes.Pros:Easy to setupWorks well with Netflix and Youtube static contentTravels well (hotel rooms, friends houses)Cons:Does not support live streams on YouTubePower cord is really quite short
author: Raka

review: For $35, this thing is a must have.  It makes a great gift for anyone who watches TV shows online.Works great with products that are fully Chromecast integrated (e.g. Netflix, Hulu, Play, YouTube).  With other online streaming (using tab casting) you may have issues that force you to play the video at 480p instead of 720p in order to cut back stuttering.  Some part of that could be limitations of my router, but the complaint seems to be fairly common.  That being said, more major websites seem to be adding Chromecast, so this product will keep getting better.My only complaint is that this device is wireless 802.11n and not 802.11ac.  We can only hope that there will be future versions with greater video capabilities, and limiting the hardware to N means that any future higher def Chromecast is going to need a new piece of hardware instead of a firmware patch.
